title: Pleurophyllum criniferum
text:
Pleurophyllum criniferum is a species of <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a> in the <a href="Asteraceae">daisy</a> <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> that is endemic to the subantarctic islands of New Zealand.
Description.
"Pleurophyllum criniferum" is a large <a href="perennial">perennial</a> <a href="herbaceous%20plant">herb</a>, growing up to 2 m in height. The <a href="leaf">leaves</a> may grow to a metre or more in length and are diverse in shape, though usually oblong-<a href="ovate%20%28leaf%29">ovate</a> to <a href="lanceolate">lanceolate</a>, the undersides covered by silky white hairs. The <a href="flower">flower</a>s occur as 15–30 <a href="head%20%28botany%29">heads</a> in elongated <a href="raceme">raceme</a>s with short and inconspicuous ray-florets and dark purple <a href="Asteraceae%23Flowers">disk-florets</a>. The plant flowers from December to February and fruits from January to May.
Distribution and habitat.
The plant is <a href="endemism">endemic</a> to <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>’s <a href="subantarctic">subantarctic</a> <a href="Antipodes%20Islands">Antipodes</a>, <a href="Auckland%20Islands">Auckland</a> and <a href="Campbell%20Island%2C%20New%20Zealand">Campbell Islands</a>, where it is a striking component of the <a href="megaherb">megaherb</a> community. It occurs from the coast up into the island ranges on <a href="peat">peat</a>y ground in <a href="herbfield">herbfield</a>s.
